TEXT.TITLE: DUTCH COST OF LIVING FALLS 1.2 PCT IN FEBRUARY
TEXT.BODY: The Dutch cost of living index (base 1980) fell 1.2 pct to 121.5 in the year to mid-February after a 1.3 pct fall in the year to mid-January 1987, the Economics Ministry said. The February index was 0.2 pct up on January. Clothing, shoe and vegetable prices rose in February while prices of coffee, heating oil and most car fuels fell, the Ministry added. REUTER
